spec: make bitwise operators stand out

The (and not) arguably sounds like it is trying to say something - and not what?.

Just an idea, won't be hurt if it gets rejected.

messages.text: Fine w/ me but let r weigh in - he also has a eye for type setting. - gri Please update the date in the beginning and change the CL from "doc: ...." to "spec: ...". http://codereview.appspot.com/6498115/diff/4001/doc/go_spec.html File doc/go_spec.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/6498115/diff/4001/doc/go_spec.html#newcode2921 doc/go_spec.html:2921: & bitwise AND integers No strong feelings but alternatively, consider and, etc. which looks a bit nicer in my mind. This is the approach taken in Warren's Hacker's Delight (see page 3, Notation). http://codereview.appspot.com/6498115/diff/4001/doc/go_spec.html#newcode3185 doc/go_spec.html:3185: && conditional and p && q is "if p then q else false" On 2012/09/11 03:11:09, dsymonds wrote: > down here too? it's not as useful, but the consistency might be worth it. agreed.
